title: Stan Getz plays Bacharach and David (1968) + Bonus / V0
description:
"What The World Needs Now: Stan Getz plays Bacharach and David" (1968). 

Long ignored by jazz folk who once thought the music of Burt Bacharach was beneath contempt, Stan Getz's collection of Bacharach-iana is arranged and performed magnificently. 

Stan Getz is backed by the likes of Chick Corea, Jim Hall, Phil Upchurch, Herbie Hancock, Ron Carter, Roy Haynes, Kenny Burrell, and Grady Tate. And with colorful but respectful and spacious arrangements by Richard Evans and Claus Ogerman, Getz and company show how strong pop material can be inspiring grist for the player's improvisational mill.

The original 11-track LP is topped off on CD by worthy outtakes of Ã¢â‚¬Å“A House Is Not a Home" and "In Between the Heartaches" along with "Tara's Theme" by Max Steiner.

The Bacharach tunes are a perfect vehicle for Stan's smooth delivery. If you love Getz and Bacharach (or simply one of the two) this is a must-have. 



Stan Getz 

What The World Needs Now:
Stan Getz Plays Bacharach and David

1968

 

  CD / 1998 / Remastered / VBR-V0



Tracklist:

1.	Wives and Lovers 

2.	Windows of the World 

3.	The Look of Love 

4.	Any Old Time of Day 

5.	Alfie 

6.	In Times Like These 

7.	A House Is Not a Home [Master Take] 

8.	Trains and Boats and Planes 

9.	What the World Needs Now Is Love 

10.	In Between the Heartaches [Edited Master Take]

11.	Walk on By 

12.	A House Is Not a Home [Alternate Take][#]

13.	In Between the Heartaches [Alternate Take][#]

14.	My Own True Love 

15.	Tara's Theme [#] 



Personnel:

Stan Getz: tenor saxophone

Chick Corea, Herbie Hancock: Piano

Kenny Burrell, Jim Hall, Phil Upchurch: guitar

Ron Carter, Walter Booker: bass

Curtis Prince, Grady Tate, Roy Haynes: drums

with string and brass orchestras,
arranged and conducted by Claus Ogerman and Richard Evans
 


Stan Getz
